articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli hostages Iair Horn, Sagui Dekel-Chen and Sasha (Alexander) Troufanov arrived at a release site in Gaza on Saturday after Egyptian and Qatari mediators helped avert a standoff that threatened to sink a fragile ceasefire.
articles.title: Three Israeli hostages set to return from Gaza as ceasefire holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz delivered a strong rebuke on Saturday to U.S. Vice President JD Vance's attack on Europe's stance toward hate speech and the far right, saying it was not right for others to tell Germany, and Europe, what to do.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz rebukes Vance, defends Europe's stance on hate speech and far right

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis, who is suffering from a respiratory infection, has spent a quiet night in hospital, the Italian news agency ANSA reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Pope spent a quiet night in hospital, ANSA says

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Marine Le Pen may be the dominant figure of the French far right, but in Trump world, a little-known European Parliament lawmaker called Sarah Knafo is making inroads.
articles.title: Meet the little-known far-right French politician with a direct line to Trump world

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Friday that China will "play along to the end" if the United States is bent on suppressing the country even though Beijing does not wish to be in conflict with Washington.
articles.title: China will 'play along to the end' with U.S., its top diplomat says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres urged dialogue between warring parties in eastern Congo on Saturday, hours after Rwanda-backed M23 rebels entered the northern suburbs of the provincial capital Bukavu.
articles.title: UN chief says 'dialogue must begin' between warring parties in eastern Congo

articles.author: Xiuhao Chen, Liz Lee
articles.description: U.S.-Philippine military exercises are longstanding, "purely defensive" and intended to maintain force readiness and preserve regional security, a U.S. State Department spokesperson said on Saturday.
articles.title: US says military exercises with Philippines 'purely defensive', for force readiness

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe needs its own plan for Ukraine and for its own security or its future will be decided by other powers, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Saturday.
articles.title: Europe needs its own plan for security and Ukraine, says Poland's Tusk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One of the Taiwan air force's new, domestically developed advanced jet trainer aircraft crashed on Saturday after reporting engine failure, though the crew safely bailed out, the military said, in a setback for the programme.
articles.title: Advanced new Taiwan jet trainer crashes in setback for programme

articles.author: Ivana Sekularac
articles.description: Thousands of students descended upon the central Serbian city of Kragujevac on Saturday in what was expected to be the biggest show of anger yet against the government over a deadly railway disaster in November.
articles.title: Thousands rally in Serbia over deadly railway disaster
